alert.note: Alert for Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 7:42PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Tuscaloosa County through 815 PM CDT... At 741 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Shelton State Community College, or 9 miles southwest of Tuscaloosa. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Tuscaloosa, Moundville, Coker, Shelton State Community College, Englewood, Ralph, Little Sandy, Taylorville, Fosters Boat Landing, Hull, Palmore Park, Mound State Park, Fosters and Romulus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Alabama.
